tachyon.worker.block

Class BlockWorker

  • java.lang.Object
    • tachyon.worker.WorkerBase
      • tachyon.worker.block.BlockWorker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Worker

    public final class BlockWorker
extends WorkerBase
    The class is responsible for managing all top level components of the Block Worker, including: Servers: BlockWorkerClientServiceHandler (RPC Server), BlockDataServer (Data Server) Periodic Threads: BlockMasterSync (Worker to Master continuous communication) Logic: BlockDataManager (Logic for all block related storage operations)

      Creates a new instance of BlockWorker.

        Returns:

      • start

        public void start()
           throws IOException
        Runs the block worker. The thread must be called after all services (e.g., web, dataserver) started.
        Throws:
        IOException - if a non-Tachyon related exception occurs

      • stop

        public void stop()
          throws IOException
        Stops the block worker. This method should only be called to terminate the worker.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the data server fails to close
